channel.title: Local Buffer Problem
channel.description:
[img]http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg191/scaled.php?server=191&filename=bufferu.png&res=medium[/img] Well, I have a buffer problem (as you can see ^), I was wondering how I can fix it, or if you have any other advice (such as, getting a download manager).
Info: Download starts at 500kb/s, has swings down to around 50kb/s, and loops back up to 500kb/s. After about an hour of downloading, it just drops to 10kb/s.
P.S. I'm downloading MSSetupv83, NOT [size=2pt]Pr0n[/size]

item.title: Local Buffer Problem
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Most web servers are programmed to give you faster downloads up until a point, then it slows down till it reaches something low like its at in the picture for the rest of the download.

Read full topic

item.title: Local Buffer Problem
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

It’s not always your ISP or software that’s the problem. The server you’re downloading it from can’t be perfect either. And with file sizes like that I wouldn’t doubt it.

Read full topic

item.title: Local Buffer Problem
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I have pretty inconsistent download speeds as well. I think it’s just my shitty ISP. I will call and complain immediately.

Read full topic
